actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 31.

Rule provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 13 and S.J. Res. 31. The resolution provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 13 and S.J. Res. 31 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate on each joint resolution. The resolution also provides for a motion to commit on both joint resolutions.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 426. S.J. Res. 31 â€” "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act"."

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4303, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University: Mr. Owens and Ms. McCollum.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4412, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development: Mr. Cole and Ms. Leger Fernandez.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the passing of the gentleman from Virginia, Mr. Connolly, the whole number of the House is 432.
The Chair designated Ms. Houlahan to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Darin LaHood to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
